title: The Warrior Of Fiana
opening: Barely escaping the burning of Castle Leonster with his life, the young Prince Leif was looked after by Finn, his knight and retainer. Together with Nanna, a young noblewoman under Finn's care, the trio fled pursuers sent by the conquerors of North Thracia: the Grannvale Empire, which lay to the west.

Yet Finn proved stronger than those who hunted them, and the three made their way to the cities of Ulster and Tarrah, posing as common vagrants. Eventually, they drifted into Fiana, a small village on Thracia's eastern coast. Fiana was an independent community with its own militia, the Freeblades of Fiana, led by the swordswoman Eyvel. Eyvel welcomed Leif's group as if they were her own kin. Under her watchful eye, the deposed prince spent his childhood in Fiana, growing into maturity alongside youths of common birth. Now, in year 776 of the Grannvale calendar...

intro.speaker: Raydrik
intro.line: Have you found that whelp of a prince yet?

intro.speaker: Weissman
intro.line: Regretfully not, milord. The men have searched the village top to bottom, but came up with nothing.

intro.speaker: Raydrik
intro.line: Why is such a simple task taking you so long? There's little doubt that the heir to House Leonster is hiding here. You've been too gentle with these villagers—give them ample motivation to talk.

intro.speaker: Weissman
intro.line: We are of the same mind, milord—I've already ordered the men to do as much. Yet the townsfolk claim the prince isn't here. According to them, he left with the Freeblades to fend off a pirate raid on a nearby village.

intro.speaker: Raydrik
intro.line: Freeblades? What nonsense is that?

intro.speaker: Weissman
intro.line: They're the local militia, sire. As I understand it, this village was once home to a group of brigands—rather savage ones, at that. About a decade ago, they were routed by Eyvel, a wandering sellsword. She claimed the village as her own and founded the Freeblades to protect the region from future attacks. She's supposedly quite a wonder with a sword...

intro.speaker: Raydrik
intro.line: Hmm... She may be a problem.

intro.speaker: Weissman
intro.line: You have nothing to fear, milord: we've taken Eyvel's daughter captive. What's more, we also captured the daughter of Finn, the very knight guarding the prince's life. With the leverage we have over them, they'll have no choice but to surrender.

intro.speaker: Raydrik
intro.line: Hmph. I admit, you have your uses, Weissman. The women will accompany me back to Munster. You'll remain here and prepare for when these upstart rebels return. See that the young Leonster pup is put in chains befitting a stray mutt.

intro.speaker: Weissman
intro.line: Your trust in me is well placed, sire. Men, bring the girls here!

intro.speaker: Raydrik
intro.line: What's your name, lass?

intro.speaker: Mareeta
intro.line: Hmph…

intro.speaker: Raydrik
intro.line: Hah! A fighting spirit to match a pretty face. Now, let's have a look at the other one... Ah, you must be Finn's young ward. I hear your mother was royalty of House Nordion, is that right? You certainly don't lack for grace, despite living in this backwater hovel—holy blood doesn't run thin even in squalor, I see.

intro.speaker: Raydrik
intro.line: What a pleasant surprise the two of you make for. Weissman, I'll be departing for Munster now. Don't disappoint me.

intro.speaker: Weissman
intro.line: All shall be as you wish it, milord.

intro.speaker: Eyvel
intro.line: What's that commotion in the village? Something's rotten here...

intro.speaker: Halvan
intro.line: I'll scout ahead, Commander. Hold here a moment.

intro.speaker: Halvan
intro.line: Commander, Fiana is packed to the brim with Imperial troops! They... must have struck while we were away.

intro.speaker: Osian
intro.line: What? No way is the Empire gonna make a mess of our home! Commander, let's move in!

intro.speaker: Halvan
intro.line: Calm down, Osian. We'll get slaughtered if we just charge in blindly.

intro.speaker: Osian
intro.line: Yeah, Halvan, I'm sure the village will appreciate your patient attitude while everyone's being rounded up and jailed!

intro.speaker: Eyvel
intro.line: Peace, Osian. Halvan is right. Seems we've finally been noticed by the Empire. Looks like this is goodbye, Little Leif. I'm sorry. Finn, take him as far away from here as you can. Leave the soldiers to us.

intro.speaker: Leif
intro.line: No, Commander! Nanna is still in the village! I won't leave without her!

intro.speaker: Eyvel
intro.line: I'll get her back. Don't worry.

intro.speaker: Leif
intro.line: It's more than that, Commander... I won't run anymore. That's my decision to make.

intro.speaker: Eyvel
intro.line: ...Finn, you wanna weigh in here? You going to let the Little Lord throw himself into harm's way like this?

intro.speaker: Finn
intro.line: Lord Leif has seen the passing of 15 summers, by now. He's old enough to choose for himself—and as my liege, I will abide by his judgment.

intro.speaker: Eyvel
intro.line: Has it been that long already? Hmph, I suppose I let Little Leif come with us to fight off those pirates, myself... Guess I made up my own mind when I did that. If Finn's all right with it, so am I.

intro.speaker: Osian
intro.line: Then what's the hold-up? If we're done arguing, there's an invasion happening over that ridge!

intro.speaker: Eyvel
intro.line: All right, get ready to move in. But stay sharp: most foot-soldiers are just regular folk, forced into the Imperial Army against their will. If they surrender, just take their weapons and let them go. Are we clear?

intro.speaker: Osian
intro.line: But we can still bloody them until they surrender, right? I mean, if we can't put up a good fight ourselves, we'll be the ones surrendering.

intro.speaker: Eyvel
intro.line: Knock 'em around if you have to, sure, but don't overdo it. That means you, Osian.

intro.speaker: Osian
intro.line: Hey, c'mon, gimme some credit, Commander!

intro.speaker: Eyvel
intro.line: OK, enough chatter! Let's give the Empire a battle worthy of our names as Freeblades!

battle.speaker: Dagdar
battle.line: Ain't no good way to go about this damned battle... Don't matter how good Eyvel is, there's only one of her an' over a dozen of them. We need to hurry.

battle.speaker: Marty
battle.line: Oh, fer cryin' out loud! Not again...

battle-talk.speaker: Eyvel
battle-talk.line: Dagdar?! You... came down to fight with us?

battle-talk.speaker: Dagdar
battle-talk.line: Eyvel! Does me heart good to see you in one piece! Listen, ya have any idea why the Empire would come all the way out here? It have anything to do with... the boy?

battle-talk.speaker: Eyvel
battle-talk.line: Yeah. The Little Lord, Leif, he's... he's not just some nobleman. He's the heir to House Leonster. I've been helping him hide from the Empire. I'm sorry... I shouldn't have kept it from you.

battle-talk.speaker: Dagdar
battle-talk.line: Mm, I figured as much. Well, no use worryin' about it now. Long as I get to cut down some of those Imperial dastards meself, we're even.

battle-talk.speaker: Osian
battle-talk.line: Tanya? What do you think you're doing here?

battle-talk.speaker: Tanya
battle-talk.line: What does it look like, Osian? I'm here to help you guys, any way I can!

battle-talk.speaker: Osian
battle-talk.line: "Help any way you can," huh? In that case, turn tail and march back home. That's the only way a kid like you could help—you'd just get in the way.

battle-talk.speaker: Tanya
battle-talk.line: You've got some nerve, Osian! You're just a kid yourself, you know! You want me gone, I'm gone—not all of us are as eager to throw ourselves into danger as you!

visit.speaker: Old Woman
visit.line: Those Imperial dogs took Dame Mareeta and Lady Nanna—just snatched 'em right up like they was cattle! You're not gonna let 'em get away with that, are you? If you're fixin' to fight the Empire, take this with you. This here ring's enchanted with some spell or another. But don't just wear it on your finger like some common bauble! You gotta actually [Use] it for it to do any good!

visit.speaker: Old Woman
visit.line: Y'all made it back! What a relief... But look, there's no Freeblades of Fiana without Fiana, right? So don't just stop with them pirates—drive the Empire from our village, too! ... Not to imply that I ain't grateful, a' course. Take this with you. Use it if you get scraped up. We don't have much in the way of medicine, but it's the least we can do after everythin' the Commander's done fer us.

visit.speaker: Old Man
visit.line: Weapons can be mighty expensive, can't they? Most folk here gotta make do by nicking supplies from Imperial troops. It's awful risky, but if you can capture an enemy alive, you get to help yourself to their stuff. Matter of fact, I got the drop on an Imperial soldier myself. Heard 'im snoring from three houses way, so I took me a souvenir! ... Not that it'll do me much good, though. Probably better off in your hands, I reckon. And hey, if you don't need it, you can just hawk it for somethin' you do need.

visit.speaker: Patricia
visit.line: Big brother! I've got something real special for you! You can use this to keep yourself safe, right?

visit.speaker: Halvan
visit.line: An... axe? Where in the world did you get such a fine weapon?

visit.speaker: Patricia
visit.line: Darnedest thing... I was walkin' past the lake up on the mountain, when this strange ol' crone just floated outta the water! She gave it to me, then vanished, quick as you can blink! I been keepin' it for you, and takin' real good care of it. Now go put it to use, an' make me proud!

visit.speaker: Patricia
visit.line: Hey, hey, have you seen my big brother, Halvan? He's got me awful scared... I hope he's all right...

visit.speaker: Father
visit.line: You pullin' your weight in the Freeblades, boy? Last thing Commander Eyvel needs is to babysit you.

visit.speaker: Osian
visit.line: We're risking life and limb to protect the village, and you're giving me a lecture? You've got a strange sense of gratitude, old man.

visit.speaker: Father
visit.line: Not even the Empire knockin' down our front door can stop that fool mouth of yours, I see. Well, no point in draggin' this out. Here. This is what you came for, right?

visit.speaker: Osian
visit.line: For once, you read my mind. When a fight breaks out, I just feel off without this axe at my side.

visit.speaker: Father
visit.line: Which don't explain why you forget it at home half the damn time!

visit.speaker: Osian
visit.line: Hey, I came here for the axe, not to get chewed out!

visit.speaker: Father
visit.line: If that's all you wanted, then get going! Go on, now! Don't keep the Commander waitin' on you!

visit.speaker: Osian
visit.line: You don't need to tell me twice!

visit.speaker: Father
visit.line: Where has that fool boy of mine gone off to in this fracas? I swear, my Osian's gonna get himself killed one of these days...

boss.speaker: Weissman
boss.line: Do you fools realize what you're doing?! If I die, so do the women we took!"

boss.speaker: Weissman
boss.line: D-Damn... You'll... love to regret this, all of you...

boss.speaker: Weissman
boss.line: Damn... Bested by a bunch of backwoods yokels. Well, I won't forget this!

end.speaker: Leif
end.line: Nanna! Mareeta! Where are you?! Please, answer me!

end.speaker: Eyvel
end.line: Little Nan, Mareeta... Raydrik must've taken 'em.

end.speaker: Leif
end.line: What?! That means... they were taken to Munster, right?

end.speaker: Eyvel
end.line: Yeah—as bargaining chips, in case Weissman couldn't finish the job. It's the sort of thing Raydrik would pull, allright.

end.speaker: Leif
end.line: Gods' breath... Commander, we have to give chase! The two of them are counting on us!

end.speaker: Leif
end.line: Commander, you yourself said I'm not a child anymore. Nanna and Mareeta were taken captive because of me—and I refuse to let anyone suffer in my place. I will never again let someone sacrifice their life in exchange for mine.

end.speaker: Eyvel
end.line: ...I understand. We leave at dawn, then. I won't lie, Little Lord: this is gonna get rough. Get some rest while you can.

end.speaker: Leif
end.line: Nanna! Mareeta! Where are you?! Please, answer me!

end.speaker: Man
end.line: L-Lord Leif! Gods' breath, are you a sight fer sore eyes! I... wish I had better news fer you. They came fer Lady Nanna, they did, and we couldn't do nuthin' to stop 'em!

end.speaker: Man
end.line: The Empire took 'er, sure as you're standin' here. Mareeta tried to break her loose, but only got captured 'erself. They both wore chains, last I saw.

end.speaker: Man
end.line: Don't rightfully know, Lord Leif. One of them soldiers said somethin' about headin' back to Munster, but nuthin' more specific'n that.

end.speaker: Leif
end.line: Munster... Then that's where I'm headed, too. I'll bring everyone home: Nanna, Mareeta, and the Commander!
